properties.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 13 at 3:15AM AKST until February 15 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Expect wind chills
to range from 50 below to 70 below zero.

* WHERE...Western Arctic Coast.

* WHEN...3 PM this afternoon to midnight Saturday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and coldest wind
chills are expected near Point Lay early Friday. East winds
could gust to 35 mph at times. The dangerously cold wind chills
will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and
sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously
low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even
hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO MIDNIGHT AKST FRIDAY NIGHT
